content: Heard on the BBC Radio: Having a religion or being an atheist is like having a pit bull: You love your Pit Bull and think it's wonderful - but it scares the hell out of everyone else.
reply: Heard on the BBC Radio: Having a religion or being an atheist is like having a pit bull: You love your Pit Bull and think it's wonderful - but it scares the hell out of everyone else.
title: Religious, Atheists & Pit bulls

content: quote: Originally posted by Fightdirector: Heard on the BBC Radio: Having a religion or being an atheist is like having a pit bull: You love your Pit Bull and think it's wonderful - but it scares the hell out of everyone else. Stereotypes. People think in worst case scenarios about many things: religious people, atheists and pit bulls, for example. But then, you never know what they might do, unless you know them. "Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees."
quote: Originally posted by Fightdirector: Heard on the BBC Radio: Having a religion or being an atheist is like having a pit bull: You love your Pit Bull and think it's wonderful - but it scares the hell out of everyone else.
reply: Stereotypes. People think in worst case scenarios about many things: religious people, atheists and pit bulls, for example. But then, you never know what they might do, unless you know them. "Beware of the leaven of the Pharisees."

content: Hmmm... I suppose all 3 can be found in all of us @ different times. Un-belief in a believer, belief in an un-believer, the urge and ability to bite whether provoked or not.

content: quote: Originally posted by TAH407: Hmmm... I suppose all 3 can be found in all of us @ different times. Un-belief in a believer, belief in an un-believer, the urge and ability to bite whether provoked or not. I, an unbeliever, never have "belief." That is to say, I never doubt my disbelief in the supernatural. Never. It's quite nice, actually, to have such stability in your thinking. ...One less thing to worry about. I'm sure most believers have constant doubts. I did, even when I thought I was a "good, solid Christian." There's a lot to question about such wild claims.
quote: Originally posted by TAH407: Hmmm... I suppose all 3 can be found in all of us @ different times. Un-belief in a believer, belief in an un-believer, the urge and ability to bite whether provoked or not.

content: quote: I'm sure most believers have constant doubts. I did, even when I thought I was a "good, solid Christian." There's a lot to question about such wild claims. The testimony of the World is greater than the testimony of Jesus. (To put a play on the bible words.) Thinking outside of the box of the bible is something the 'solid Christians' don't want you to do. They have little confidence in their myth outside of the mythmaking text.
